title: Add multi-coach “Meet Our Expert Coaches” section and prepare Google Map location update

requirements.text: Update the existing trainer/coaches section (currently implemented in `frontend/src/components/sections/TrainerHighlights.tsx` and rendered on the homepage) to be a multi-coach “Meet Our Expert Coaches” section that displays the user-provided initial 3 coach profiles: (1) Lavesh Kodwani — “Strength, Conditioning, Weight Loss & Nutrition Expert” — “8+ years”; (2) Hemraj Dhakar — “Strength, Weight Loss” — “3+ Years”; (3) Ishika Sahu — “Zumba & Dance Fitness” (no experience provided).

quotes:
1. Name: Lavesh Kodwani
Strength, Conditioning, Weight Loss & Nutrition Expert Experiance 8+ years            
2. Name: Hemraj Dhakar                                                                                          Strength, Weight Loss      Experiance: 3+ Years                                                                                                                          3. Ishika Sahu
Zumba & Dance Fitness

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage still renders a coaches grid section in the same place the current `TrainerHighlights` section appears.
Section heading uses the wording “Meet Our Expert Coaches” (English).
Exactly 3 coach cards are shown with names and specialties matching the provided text (spelling normalized only for obvious formatting issues; do not invent new specialties).
Experience is displayed for Lavesh Kodwani (“8+ years”) and Hemraj Dhakar (“3+ Years”) and is omitted (or clearly not shown) for Ishika Sahu since no experience was provided.
The implementation clearly supports adding more coaches (e.g., driven by a single array/data structure rather than hard-coded JSX per coach).

requirements.text: Make the coaches list easy to maintain by centralizing the coaches data in a single, obvious frontend location (for example a config export similar to `MARKETING_CONFIG`) and update the coaches section to consume that data.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single source of truth for the coaches list (names/specialties/experience) that can be extended with additional coaches without editing the rendering logic.
`TrainerHighlights` (or its replacement) renders by mapping over the centralized coaches list.

requirements.text: Prepare the Google Maps location update by ensuring the embedded map uses `MARKETING_CONFIG.googleMapsEmbedUrl` (already referenced by `frontend/src/components/sections/MapEmbed.tsx`) and document (in code comments) exactly where to paste the new Google Maps embed URL once the user provides it; do not change the current embed URL value until the user supplies the new location URL/address.
acceptanceCriteria: `MapEmbed` continues to read the map iframe `src` from `MARKETING_CONFIG.googleMapsEmbedUrl`.
A clear code comment exists adjacent to `googleMapsEmbedUrl` in `frontend/src/config/marketing.ts` indicating it should be replaced with the new Google Maps embed URL when provided.
No other parts of the app break due to this change (map still renders with the current URL).

requirements.text: When the new Google Maps location details are provided later (either a full Google Maps embed URL or an address), update location-dependent user-facing text and structured data to stay consistent across the site (map embed, contact page SEO text, and JSON-LD geo/address where applicable), using English text.
acceptanceCriteria: After providing a new location, the map iframe points to the new place.
Location text shown on the Contact/Book Trial page remains consistent with the configured address/city/state.
`frontend/src/components/seo/Seo.tsx` structured data remains consistent with the configured address and does not contain mismatched/old location details once the new location is applied.

constraints: Do not edit files listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep all changes within the existing single-actor backend architecture; do not introduce additional canisters/services.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing a backend/admin UI for editing coaches or marketing configuration.
Adding coach photos or biographies (not requested).
Changing business hours, lead capture, or other unrelated marketing content.
